goals.question: What is the distribution of housing prices in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of housing prices in the University District and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of the 'bedrooms' and 'price' fields
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District.

goals.question: What is the most common type of property in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of property types in the University District and identify any trends.

goals.question: What is the average rating of properties in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of review scores for properties in the University District and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the distance between properties and the University of Washington?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of distances between properties and the University of Washington and identify any outliers.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['price'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Price')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of housing prices in the University District?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['bedrooms'], data['price'])
    plt.xlabel('Bedrooms')
    plt.ylabel('Price')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title("What is the relationship between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    property_counts = data['property_type'].value_counts()
    property_counts.plot(kind='bar')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title("What is the most common type of property in the University District?", wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.boxplot(data['review_scores_rating'].dropna())
    plt.title("What is the average rating of properties in the University District?")
    plt.xlabel("University District")
    plt.ylabel("Review Scores Rating")
    plt.xticks([1], ["University District"])
    avg_rating = data['review_scores_rating'].mean()
    plt.axhline(avg_rating, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Average Rating: {avg_rating:.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['distance'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Distance')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the distance between properties and the University of Washington?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
